dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: 'Magnificent 7,' crypto, Trump coin, AI, Trump, tariffs, Fed, and everything else that will dominate Davos
News Content: This is The Takeaway from today's Morning Brief, which you can sign up to receive in your inbox every morning along with:

The chart of the day What we're watching What we're reading Economic data releases and earnings

Coverage of the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, each year is something I view as a competitive sport.

I actually start training for the intense week over the summer, as my few close friends know (and yes, they all make fun of me). The number of workouts every week in the lead-up rises incrementally so I can easily sprint up and down the two-mile promenade with a backpack to stuff in as many meetings as humanly possible (yes, I do this).

My one cheat meal a week gets replaced by green drinks and extra doses of vitamins to ensure I don't get sick. I meditate twice a day and carefully pick out clothes I know will help me execute at the highest level. Look good, feel good, good things happen.

To me, this one event is the closest I will get to being like Michael Jordan in the playoffs — and I am very lucky to be in attendance.

And this year, the gathering of the elites flying in on private jets to wax poetic on the world's biggest problems will be extra nutty.

Read more: Here are the biggest global risks for 2025

The conference unofficially kicks off on Trump's Inauguration Day. Some CEOs I know who normally would be at Davos all week are dropping in mid-week after working the inauguration party rounds. By Tuesday, the newly minted president may have uncorked a host of executive orders that could impact the businesses of the top CEOs on the ground. And, of course, impact the global markets.

This is why this year's WEF will be more important than the norm for you, the average investor. The headlines will be coming in hot and heavy as CEOs look to challenge Trump or get on his good side. They will also look to talk up their businesses ahead of the start of earnings season, and with markets getting a little rockier of late.

Here's what yours truly and our very own Jennifer Schonberger will be watching while bundled up in five layers all week. Be sure to bookmark the "streaming now" section on Yahoo Finance to catch all our market-moving interviews in real time. Or tune in where you normally catch us, whether that's on Samsung TV or our nifty app.

Unlike our previous trips to Davos over the past decade, I will be taping several special episodes of the Opening Bid podcast on the ground. I could tell you who those guests will be, but where is the fun in that? Best to be surprised!

Story Continues

Now, on to that guide...

Big bank CEOs: The biggest names in banking, such as JPMorgan (JPM) CEO Jamie Dimon, Bank of America (BAC) CEO Brian Moynihan, Goldman Sachs (GS) CEO David Solomon, Citi (C) CEO Jane Fraser, and Morgan Stanley (MS) CEO Ted Pick will be in attendance. While this group will all get asked about Trump policies, it's going to be their outlook on interest rates that will be most key to market sentiment. Most have not spoken publicly since the Fed signaled a likely halt in rate cuts last month, and they will want to be heard ahead of the Fed's Jan. 28-29 policy meeting.

The tariff CEOs: Retail will have a nice showing at Davos, with the CEOs of Polo Ralph Lauren (RL), Williams Sonoma (WSM), and Gap (GAP) (their CEO's first time at the event) making the rounds. These companies are right in the middle of the tariff debate. I'll be interested in how they are preparing for Trump tariffs from a supply chain perspective. I am also interested in how much they could raise prices post-tariffs — it could offer valuable insight into the 2025 inflation outlook and Fed policy.

Read more: How do tariffs work, and who really pays them?

The race to catch Nvidia: It will be another year of artificial intelligence chatter throughout the halls of Davos. This time, I think the discussions will take two forms. First, unlike last year, where the AI discussions were mostly about potential, investors are going to want to see clear lines to revenue and profits. So I encourage AI CEOs to bring it. And two, we will probably hear more about how Big Tech players in Microsoft (MSFT) and Alphabet (GOOGL) are aiming to develop their own high-powered AI chips to catch Nvidia (NVDA), or at least make good enough chips to diversify. Leaders from OpenAI and Anthropic will also be in attendance, and their thoughts on chips could be key. I'll be watching Nvidia's stock price like a hawk this week, and you should be as well.

Crypto delegation: The crypto industry has had a solid presence at Davos in the past five years. This year, the industry is expected to be out in force, headlined by an appearance from Coinbase (COIN) CEO Brian Armstrong. I'll be quite attuned to what the crypto crowd thinks about the latest volatility in bitcoin, MicroStrategy's (MSTR) bitcoin buying binge, what they are hearing from the pro-crypto Trump administration, and early assessments on Paul Atkins as the likely next SEC chairman.

And of course, the new Trump coin that debuted to much fanfare (and market cap) on Friday.

The token quickly rose to a market cap of $73 billion in about 48 hours, surpassing DOGE as the largest meme coin so far.

The market cap of the crypto has since dropped to $12 billion from its launch, according to CoinMarketCap.

Stocks: Stocks are beginning to look top-heavy (especially the Magnificent 7), as I have reported. I'm eager to hear from market pros such as JPMorgan's Mary Erdoes and economic experts like Nouriel Roubini on whether they are seeing red flags on the horizon. Any calls they make at this Davos may hold greater weight given more volatile market conditions and increased Trump policy uncertainty.

The political wild cards: As of this writing, contacts have told me President-elect Donald Trump plans to send delegates to Davos. Who precisely gets the nod is the wild card. (I fancy it will be potential Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick, a Davos party scene regular for many years. Elon has long hated Davos, so hard to see him appearing). Trump himself is slated to give a speech remotely on Thursday, a source told Yahoo Finance.

But who ultimately shows up from Trump's orbit — and what they say once touching down — could set the tone on US international relations right out of the gate. If a delegate arrives at Davos days after Trump takes actions that could weigh on the economic growth of foreign countries and then aims to explain the actions, best believe the inevitable headlines may not be so market-friendly.

—

Brian Sozzi is Yahoo Finance's Executive Editor. Follow Sozzi on X @BrianSozzi, Instagram, and on LinkedIn. Tips on stories? Email brian.sozzi@yahoofinance.com. Three times each week, Sozzi fields insight-filled conversations with the biggest names in business and markets on Yahoo Finance's Opening Bid podcast. Find more episodes on our video hub. Watch on your preferred streaming service. Or listen and subscribe on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, or wherever you find your favorite podcasts.

Click here for in-depth analysis of the latest stock market news and events moving stock prices

Read the latest financial and business news from Yahoo Finance

View Comments

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news discusses the significant political and economic ramifications tied to the upcoming World Economic Forum (WEF) in Davos, emphasizing potential impact on major companies, including tech giants like Apple. With the presence of influential CEOs and a new presidential administration potentially shifting market dynamics through tariffs and policies, there is an increased level of uncertainty. However, the focus on innovation, particularly in AI, may benefit tech companies such as Apple that are involved in this sector. The overall sentiment seems cautious due to market volatility and geopolitical factors, leading to moderate probabilities for stock fluctuations.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news article focuses on the Davos World Economic Forum and various themes that will dominate discussions, including the potential impact of a new Trump administration, tariffs, AI, crypto, and macroeconomic outlooks from prominent figures. While Apple (AAPL) isn't directly mentioned as leading any specific Davos theme, its status as a 'Magnificent 7' stock means broader market sentiment and commentary on tech, interest rates, and potential trade issues could influence its price. The article mentions that stocks are starting to look top-heavy like that of Magnificent 7, leading to a negative sentiment to the stock. Given the uncertainties surrounding Trump's policies and potential market volatility alongside the 'top heavy' comment on Magnificent 7, I believe the probability of a price decrease is greater than an increase.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.25, Reasoning: The provided news article focuses on the World Economic Forum in Davos and its potential impact on various sectors, including banking, retail, AI, and crypto.  While it mentions several companies including Apple competitors like Microsoft and Nvidia, there's no direct mention of Apple or any specific news directly related to its performance or future prospects. The article discusses potential macroeconomic shifts (interest rates, tariffs, etc.) and the impact of the new administration's policies. These are broad macroeconomic factors that could indirectly affect Apple's stock price positively or negatively.  However, without specific news on Apple itself, it is difficult to assess a direct impact. Therefore, the probabilities are assigned assuming a neutral impact with slightly higher probability for a flat or slightly positive movement based on Apple's general market position and the overall positive outlook for the tech sector despite macroeconomic uncertainty.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.5, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.5, Reasoning: The provided news content primarily discusses broad market themes and events at the World Economic Forum in Davos, including topics like AI, tariffs, Fed policy, and political developments. While Apple Inc. (AAPL) is part of the 'Magnificent 7' mentioned in the headline, the article does not directly address any company-specific news or developments for Apple. The market sentiment could be influenced indirectly by general trends (e.g., AI, tariffs, or Fed policy), but there is no clear positive or negative catalyst specific to Apple. Therefore, the stock movement probabilities are assigned as neutral, with a slight tilt towards volatility due to broader market uncertainty.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news article discusses various market-moving topics that will be covered at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, including Trump's policies, tariffs, AI, and crypto. Apple Inc. (AAPL) is not directly mentioned in the article. However, as one of the 'Magnificent 7' stocks, it may be indirectly affected by the overall market sentiment and discussions around Big Tech. The article mentions that the 'Magnificent 7' stocks are looking top-heavy, which could imply a higher risk of a stock price fall. Nevertheless, without specific news about Apple, it's difficult to assess a significant impact on its stock price. Therefore, I estimate the probabilities based on the general market sentiment and the indirect impact on Apple.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.5, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.5, Reasoning: The news article discusses the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, and its potential impact on the stock market. The article mentions various CEOs, including those from the banking and retail industries, who will be attending the event and discussing topics such as interest rates, tariffs, and artificial intelligence. The article also mentions the potential for market-moving headlines and the impact of Trump's policies on the economy. However, the article does not provide any specific information about Apple Inc. (AAPL) or its stock performance. Given the lack of direct information about Apple, the probabilities of the stock price rising or falling are uncertain and will depend on various market and economic factors. Nevertheless, considering the overall tone of the article and the potential for market volatility, a neutral probability assessment is provided.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The financial news covers multiple macroeconomic and geopolitical factors including the World Economic Forum in Davos, tariffs, AI, crypto, and Trump's policies. These elements introduce market uncertainties affecting broad indices rather than a single company like Apple Inc. (AAPL). While specific impacts on AAPL aren't highlighted, the overall market sentiment could potentially affect its stock price depending on broader economic outcomes or CEO presentations.
Round: 1
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The article discusses various macroeconomic and geopolitical factors driven by the World Economic Forum in Davos, such as tariffs, AI, and the incoming Trump administration's policies. While Apple (AAPL) is part of the 'Magnificent 7' stocks, there is no direct mention of Apple or its recent performance. The 'top-heavy' nature of these stocks implies potential risks, leading to a cautious sentiment. Additionally, the uncertainty surrounding Trump's policies could lead to market volatility. Given these factors, I estimate a slightly higher probability of a stock price decline despite Apple's strong market position.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.43, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.57, Reasoning: The previous predictions show a mixed sentiment, with some models slightly favoring a price decrease due to market uncertainty and the "top-heavy" nature of Magnificent 7 stocks, while others suggest a neutral impact given the lack of direct Apple news. There's a slight trend towards increased uncertainty. Given that the news primarily focuses on broader market and macroeconomic factors discussed at Davos, including potential policy impacts from a new Trump administration and discussions surrounding tariffs, AI, and interest rates, Apple's stock could be affected indirectly. Being part of the 'Magnificent 7', Apple isn't immune to general market sentiment. However, there's no specific Apple-related news to suggest a definite direction. A somewhat conservative approach, acknowledging the potential for market volatility with the lack of company-specific positive news and trend of decreased probability of stock rise across turns, seems appropriate. Apple's involvement in the AI space might cushion the downside risk, but the other factors prevail.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news article focuses on the Davos World Economic Forum and its potential impact on various sectors, with a significant emphasis on macroeconomic factors and political uncertainty surrounding the new administration.  Apple, as part of the 'Magnificent 7', is indirectly impacted by the overall market sentiment.  The article highlights concerns about a potential 'top-heavy' market, especially affecting tech giants like Apple.  While AI is a positive factor for Apple's future, the overarching uncertainty related to tariffs, interest rates, and general market volatility increases the probability of a stock price fall.  The lack of Apple-specific news further contributes to uncertainty.  Considering previous predictions that leaned towards a higher probability of a fall and the uncertain macro environment, I predict a slightly higher probability of Apple's stock price decreasing compared to increasing.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news article discusses the World Economic Forum in Davos and its potential impact on various sectors, including banking, retail, AI, and crypto. While Apple Inc. (AAPL) is part of the 'Magnificent 7' mentioned in the headline, the article does not directly address any company-specific news or developments for Apple. The market sentiment could be influenced indirectly by general trends (e.g., AI, tariffs, or Fed policy), but there is no clear positive or negative catalyst specific to Apple. Previous predictions from other models also reflect a neutral to slightly negative sentiment, with probabilities leaning towards a potential fall due to broader market uncertainties and the mention of 'Magnificent 7' stocks looking top-heavy. Therefore, the stock movement probabilities are assigned as neutral with a slight tilt towards a potential fall.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.42, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.58, Reasoning: The news article discusses various market-moving topics at the World Economic Forum in Davos, including Trump's policies, tariffs, AI, and crypto. Apple Inc. (AAPL) is not directly mentioned but is part of the 'Magnificent 7' stocks, which are noted to be looking top-heavy. This could imply a higher risk of a stock price fall. However, without specific news about Apple, it's difficult to assess a significant impact on its stock price. The overall market sentiment and indirect impact on Apple suggest a cautious outlook.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.48, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.52, Reasoning: The news article discusses various market-moving topics that will be covered at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, including Trump's policies, tariffs, AI, and crypto. While Apple Inc. (AAPL) is not directly mentioned in the article, as one of the 'Magnificent 7' stocks, it may be indirectly affected by the overall market sentiment and discussions around Big Tech. The article mentions that the 'Magnificent 7' stocks are looking top-heavy, which could imply a higher risk of a stock price fall. Considering the lack of direct information about Apple and the potential for market volatility due to the discussed topics, the probabilities are estimated with a slight bias towards a potential fall, acknowledging the overall uncertainty and the indirect impact of broad market trends on Apple's stock.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The financial news covers multiple macroeconomic and geopolitical factors including the World Economic Forum in Davos, tariffs, AI, crypto, and Trump's policies. These elements introduce market uncertainties affecting broad indices rather than a single company like Apple Inc. (AAPL). While specific impacts on AAPL aren't highlighted, the overall market sentiment could potentially affect its stock price depending on broader economic outcomes or CEO presentations. The previous predictions show a mix of sentiments with some models leaning towards a higher probability of the stock price falling. Considering the general cautious sentiment and historical market performance during similar high-uncertainty events, the probability leans towards a slightly lower stock price.
Round: 2
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news discusses various macroeconomic and geopolitical factors surrounding the World Economic Forum in Davos, including Trump's policies, tariffs, AI, and the uncertainty in the market. While Apple Inc. is part of the 'Magnificent 7' and may benefit from AI discussions, the mention of the stocks being top-heavy implies potential risks for a decline. Additionally, the lack of company-specific news regarding Apple increases the cautious sentiment. Overall, the probabilities lean towards a higher chance of price fall due to general market volatility and uncertainty influenced by the discussions at Davos.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The repeated mention of 'Magnificent 7' stocks like Apple being 'top-heavy' creates a negative bias. The Davos discussions around Trump's policies, tariffs, and interest rates introduce market uncertainties. While AI is a positive factor, the lack of specific positive news for Apple coupled with broader market volatility overshadows it. The consensus from previous predictions is trending towards a higher probability of a stock price fall. The slight positive movement of the stock rising probability is because the delegates from Trump Adminstration might offer some ease to current economy situation, but its probability is quite low so it doesn't affect much on the movement of the stock.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The news focuses on the Davos World Economic Forum and its potential impact on various sectors, with a strong emphasis on macroeconomic factors and political uncertainty. Apple, as part of the "Magnificent 7," is indirectly affected by the overall market sentiment.  The article highlights concerns about a potentially "top-heavy" market, particularly impacting technology giants like Apple. While Apple's involvement in AI is a potential positive, the prevailing uncertainties regarding tariffs, interest rates, and general market volatility significantly increase the likelihood of a price decrease. The lack of specific Apple-related news and the trend of decreasing probability of stock price rise across previous prediction rounds further supports this assessment. The previous predictions show a clear trend towards a higher probability of a stock price fall.  Considering this trend, the overall market uncertainty, and the lack of positive Apple-specific news, I've assigned a higher probability to a stock price decline.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news article discusses the World Economic Forum in Davos and its potential impact on various sectors, including banking, retail, AI, and crypto. While Apple Inc. (AAPL) is part of the 'Magnificent 7' mentioned in the headline, the article does not directly address any company-specific news or developments for Apple. The market sentiment could be influenced indirectly by general trends (e.g., AI, tariffs, or Fed policy), but there is no clear positive or negative catalyst specific to Apple. Previous predictions from other models also reflect a neutral to slightly negative sentiment, with probabilities leaning towards a potential fall due to broader market uncertainties and the mention of 'Magnificent 7' stocks looking top-heavy. Therefore, the stock movement probabilities are assigned as neutral with a slight tilt towards a potential fall.

Apple Inc. (AAPL) is part of the 'Magnificent 7' stocks mentioned to be looking top-heavy, implying potential risks. While there is no direct mention of Apple or its performance, the overall market sentiment and uncertainty surrounding Trump's policies and macroeconomic trends could indirectly affect Apple's stock price. Previous predictions show a mixed but slightly negative sentiment, with several models leaning towards a higher probability of a stock price fall due to market volatility and the lack of company-specific positive news.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.42, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.58, Reasoning: The news article discusses various macroeconomic and geopolitical factors driven by the World Economic Forum in Davos, including tariffs, AI, and the incoming Trump administration's policies. While Apple (AAPL) is part of the 'Magnificent 7' stocks, there is no direct mention of Apple or its recent performance. The 'top-heavy' nature of these stocks implies potential risks, leading to a cautious sentiment. Additionally, the uncertainty surrounding Trump's policies could lead to market volatility. Given these factors and considering the previous predictions from other models, which reflect a neutral to slightly negative sentiment, the probabilities are assigned with a slight bias towards a potential fall.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The financial news covers multiple macroeconomic and geopolitical factors including the World Economic Forum in Davos, tariffs, AI, crypto, and Trump's policies. These elements introduce market uncertainties affecting broad indices rather than a single company like Apple Inc. (AAPL). While specific impacts on AAPL aren't highlighted, the overall market sentiment could potentially affect its stock price depending on broader economic outcomes or CEO presentations. The previous predictions show a mix of sentiments with some models leaning towards a higher probability of the stock price falling. Considering the general cautious sentiment and historical market performance during similar high-uncertainty events, the probability leans towards a slightly lower stock price.


Now give your prediction about the probability of the stock price of the relevant company rising or falling. Format your response in JSON format and include the following information as follows: 
{ 
"reasoning": "[Summarize your analysis and reasoning process here]", 
"company_name": "[Company Name indicating the name of the company]", 
"company_symbol": "[Company Symbol indicating the stock symbol of the company]", 
"news_headline": "[News Headline indicating the provided financial news headline]", 
"probability_of_stock_price_rise": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will rise due to this news], 
"probability_of_stock_price_fall": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will fall due to this news], 
} 
Do not generate output that isn't in properly formatted JSON.

```json
{
"reasoning": "The financial news covers multiple macroeconomic and geopolitical factors including the World Economic Forum in Davos, tariffs, AI, crypto, and Trump's policies. These elements introduce market uncertainties affecting broad indices rather than a single company like Apple Inc. (AAPL). While specific impacts on AAPL aren't highlighted, the overall market sentiment could potentially affect its stock price depending on broader economic outcomes or CEO presentations. The previous predictions show a mix of sentiments with some models strongly leaning towards a higher probability of the stock price falling. Considering the general cautious sentiment and historical market performance during high-uncertainty events, the probability leans towards a slightly lower stock price.",
"company_name": "Apple Inc.",
"company_symbol": "AAPL",
"news_headline": "'Magnificent 7,' crypto, Trump coin, AI, Trump, tariffs, Fed, and everything else that will dominate Davos",
"probability_of_stock_price_rise": 0.3,
"probability_of_stock_price_fall": 0.65
}
```
